page.title: 16Fashion - Peterborough.
page.content: Jeans, sweat shirts, trainers and lightweight jackets are the most popular clothes in 1985 for young men. For women the most popular clothes are jumpers, high heel shoes and skirts. The length of a skirt is just above or just below the knees. Clothes cost a lot of money. For instance, a good child's pair of jeans cost Â£9.99 and a girl's lime coloured summer dress Â£6.99. Some people wear very brightly coloured, almost flourescent socks, belts and head and wrist bands in yellow, red, green and pink. There are also fashions for hair. Some people in their teens have their hair almost shaved off of have it dyed different colours like red, green or blue. But most people just have their hair cut to different lengths with females wearing theirs longer.
